intro: Diplotaenia bingolensis, commonly known as the Bingöl endemic plant, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant is typically found in rocky or mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
